description: Ms. codex. Title supplied by cataloger. 19 lines per page. Written in medium small naskh in black ink. Catchword on the verso of each leaf. Dark cream glazed paper with laid and chain lines visible. Fol. i is a fly-leaf with a modern label. On fol. 1a: Title of the first text followed by a table of contents by another hand (listing a few texts which are not in the actual state of the ms.). In this table as in the numbering in red ink of the texts, some texts here distinguished are not considered separate (texts 6, 8, and 11 in the table of contents of this record). On fol. 70a: Ownership statement and inscriptions. Copied by Muḥammad ibn Muḥammad ibn Abī Shāmah al-M[-]lī al-Ḥanbalī in Shaʻbān 814 in the Madrasat Abī ʻUmar? [in Damascus?, cf. Sauvaget, Les monuments historiques de Damas, no. 87] (see fol. 23a, 29b). However, if the Badr al-Dīn al-Ghazzī quoted on fol. 98a is Muḥammad ibn Muḥammad (1499-1577), this date might be incorrect.
author: Ibn Taymīyah, Aḥmad ibn ʻAbd al-Ḥalīm, 1263-1328
abstract: Collection of several texts, mostly by Ibn Taymīyah.
contents: 15. fol. 98a: [Verses of poetry] / Badr al-Dīn al-Ghazzī.
extent: i, 98 leaves: paper ; 175 x 132 (135 x 103) mm.
title: Lamḥat al-mukhtaṭif fī al-farq bayna al-ṭalāq wa-al-ḥilf ... [etc.].
provenance: Ownership statement on fol. 70a. Acquired from Abraham Shalom Yahuda, 1942.
contributor: Muḥammad ibn Muḥammad ibn Abī Shāmah al-Ḥanbalī
creator: ابن تيمية، احمد بن عبد الحليم
subject: Manuscripts, Arabic—New Jersey—Princeton
binding_note: Disbound. The sewing holes are visible.
member_of_collections: Princeton Digital Library of Islamic Manuscripts
